example_sentence_english: I am shouting to be heard.
You shout too much in class.
We shout together at the stadium.
You shout too much at night.
You were shouting for no reason.

translation_english: he was shouting/she was shouting/you (formal) were shouting

example_sentence_english: We were shouting at the concert.
You were shouting for the team.
They were shouting against the traffic.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'urlato'
used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'urlato'

translation_english: he has shouted/she has shouted/you (formal) have shouted
notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'urlato'; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: He has shouted into the microphone.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'urlato'
used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'urlato'
example_sentence_english: You have shouted at the party.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'urlato'
